skillTree.localised_description: Pugnacious and stubborn, the war beasts that pull these ramshackle chariots are grotesque combinations of great boar and mighty ram.

attributes.description: Vanguard Deployment||This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Those strong enough to tame the powerful, unruly Razorgors can harness them for chariots.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice â€“ a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
A palpable miasma of fell sorcery surrounds the Bray-Shaman, distorting and maiming reality.
Shamans do not generally engage in physical combat themselves, instead sending out their spirit to possess a suitably monstrous surrogate.
Bray-Shamans speak the will of the Dark Gods, and those that defy them pay the highest price of all.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

Winds of Magic cost: +15% for all enemy spells
	(enemy armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: He knows. Nobody knows how, but he does. He has always just known.
Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Impenetrably matted fur and grim trinkets make the Bray-Shamans more than just vile to behold, but incredibly hard to injure.
By the Bray-Shamanâ€™s incantations, those lesser in body or mind have their hair and fur clogged into impervious hides.

effects.description:
Armour: +15 for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: In the right hands the braystaff is not just a symbol of position or conduit of magic, but also a brutal weapon.
In frenzied ritual celebration the Bray-Shaman invokes the Dark Godsâ€™ power to infuse the herds with bestial strength.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +15% for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: The Bray-Shaman magnifies the savage and animalistic parts of the foe's psyche until they are no more than growling beasts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Devolve Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Bray-Shaman inflames the uncontrollable urge to rend the foe limb from limb, causing the roaring, bellowing mass to surge forward.
This spell unleashes a howling roar of such intensity that it mashes brains and bursts eyeballs.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Bray-Scream Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A vile wave indeed, the creeping things that nest in the decaying undergrowth swarm all over the foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Viletide Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A red-hot spear of wrath is driven into enemy mounts' wild hearts, causing them to turn upon their riders.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Traitor-Kin Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Ghorok was a legendary Minotaur, ferocious as a storm. His spirit-mantle is terrible and dangerous to the bearer.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Mantle of Ghorok Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Mantle of Ghorok"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Mantle of Ghorok Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Bray-Shaman sends his mind into the wilds, possessing the largest creature he can find and storming back with a vengeance.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -5 for "Savage Dominion"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(all units in army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The great green orb hangs ominously in the sky above, its followers driven to acts of madness and depravity.
A summons to war in which all are drawn into the cacophonous charge; glory or sanguine death is the prize.

skillTree.localised_description: At the head of the warherd, he whips his followers into a frothing furore, then unleashes them upon the enemy.

skillTree.localised_description: The Beastlord truly has no mercy â€“ those who flee will soon find all paths lead to a brutal end by arrow or axe.

skillTree.localised_description: No beast can truly be controlled, but these desperate contrivances bring the smallest semblance of order.

skillTree.localised_description: These colossal, brutish warriors are the core of any true brayherd.

skillTree.localised_description: Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.

skillTree.localised_description: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."
The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, God Gors and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Beastmenâ€™s elite menagerie â€“ the brayherds â€“ slaughter all those caught in their savage, animalistic sights.

Speed: +10% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Razorgor Herd, Razorgor Chariot, Tuskgor Chariot, Chaos Warhounds, Feral Manticore and Harpies units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: Only a select few from a herd gain their Beastlord's acknowledgement â€“ a prize earned through the carnage and chaos they spread in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The stench of magic is palpable. No mage can stand in the midst of battle against the baying warherds.

skillTree.localised_description: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.
The ground shakes. The earth moves. The spirit trembles. The Beastman comes.
For those who face the warherd, a fate worse than death awaits their salivating jaws and unremitting bloodlust.
Unknowingly, the Beastmen serve their dark and Ruinous Gods, who in turn bless their every action.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: A pungent mix of fell unguents ensures the unholy vitality of oneâ€™s minions.

Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
When the warherd gathers, there is much feasting, debauchery, and revelling in mania and depravity.
Brought into this world by the cataclysm of Chaos, Beastmen are the very image of a dread future.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: They bray beneath the weird, green moon, and do their perverse, grim butchery in the name of the heretical Gods.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Some beings just don't know when to put the bottle down.
More than mere bloodlust, this one is filled with the primal, Ruinous rage of the Lord of Battle.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one has something of the compost heap about themâ€¦
The Dark Tongue is an apt medium through which to torment, mock and enrage the foe.
Sometimes, letting so much blood that the soil itself is stained just isn't enough. And it will never be.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Minotaur units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This spell calls to the creeping things of the undergrowth, sending a swarm of spiders, centipedes and slug-beetles onto the foe.
Blessed by the Dark Gods to never feel pain.
His scent is strong even amongst the herd.
Ungors obey!

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

Melee and missile weapon damage: +10% for Ungor units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Herds crumble but he stands.
Wild as a warhound, he never sleeps.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +4 for Chaos Warhounds and Harpies units.
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always watching and stalking his pray!

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(all units in army)
